intro: Eriostemma lauterbachii, commonly known as the Lauterbach's eriostemma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with finely divided lobes and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
